reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: The objective of this project is to continue to support development of a representative empowered voice for migrant workers in Thailand by providing capacity building and resources to the Migrant Worker Rights Network (MWRN) a unique grassroots migrant mov ement. Project partners will continue to build upon the previous 2015-2017 project and work together to create increased space for organising/negotiations between export companies and migrants across more areas of Thailand than previous. This project will combine grassroots negotiations in Thailand with European level media and corporate social responsibility advocacy work. Key activities include: evaluating previous 2015?2017 project activities and planning next steps conducting research on migrant work co nditions in a Thai export company/supply chain exporting to EU, organizing workers in factories using joint MWRN/Finnwatch research and publicity as negotiating tool, capacity building MWRN for long term planning recruiting more members for stronger MWRN, training migrant workers, planning and opening of a new MWRN/MWRN associated resource center in Thailand, providing legal aid to workers. In the original project plan the overall project length was estimated as nine years. Due to the fact that Finnish Mini stry for Foreign Affairs changed the application periods MWRN and Finnwatch decided to apply funding now only for a one-year continuation project to enable evaluation of project implementation and results between 2015-2017. On the basis of the evaluation r esults a four-year continuation project will be deliberated on in 2018.
